Job summary
Amazon's Quantitative Business Intelligence Tools (QuBIT) team is looking for motivated individuals with strong analytical and science skills to evolve one of the most complex supply-chain systems in the world.

Amazon’s supply-chain comprises thousands of fixed infrastructure nodes with millions of possible connections between them. Billions of packages flow through this network on a yearly basis, making the impact of optimal improvements truly innovative. This job offers is a terrific opportunity to analyze Amazon data and understand, model, optimize, and reshape one of the world's most supply-chains.

Your main focus will be on developing predictive models for critical planning entities; analyzing large amount of data to identify and evaluate opportunities to improve customer experience, network speed, cost and efficiency; and presenting the results to non-technical audience with the aid of visualization tools. You will leverage optimization approaches to evaluate trade-offs between potentially competing business objectives and improve decision-making. You will identify effective metrics to quantify the improvements resulting from the application of your developed tools.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate deep understanding of statistical and machine learning concepts, technical skills for leveraging analytical tools to solve large scale problems, aptitude to remain abreast with data science related technologies and excitement to take iterative approaches to tackle long-term challenges. The successful candidate will have good communication skills and ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience; will collaborate effectively with fellow scientists, data/software engineers, and product/program managers; and will deliver business value in a close partnership with many stakeholders from operations, finance and software-engineering.

Key job responsibilities
In this role, you'll be expected to work on well defined business problems related to Amazon Fulfillment Center Operations (labor planning, capacity planning, etc) and use the appropriate data science techniques to design and implement a workable solution for them. You'll also work alongside the product/program managers to define the success criteria for the solution and set up the appropriate tracking/reporting mechanisms.

About the team
The science team within QuBIT comprises 6 data scientists coming from a diverse background! Our mission is to continuously evolve our operations by developing robust and well-researched science solutions. Outside of constantly adding business value through those solutions, our team keeps abreast of evolving science field by learning new concepts and algorithms dedicatedly every week, and we share the knowledge across team members through monthly learning sessions!

The base pay range for this position in Colorado is $ 119,300 - $160,000 a year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon’s internal or external careers site.

About thredUP:
thredUP is transforming resale with technology and a mission to inspire a new generation of consumers to think secondhand first. By making it easy to buy and sell secondhand, thredUP has become one of the world’s largest resale platforms for women’s and kids’ apparel, shoes and accessories. Sellers love thredUP because we make it easy to clean out their closets and unlock value for themselves or for the charity of their choice while doing good for the planet. Buyers love shopping value, premium and luxury brands all in one place, at up to 90% off estimated retail price. Our proprietary operating platform is the foundation for our managed marketplace and consists of distributed processing infrastructure, proprietary software and systems and data science expertise. In 2018, we extended our platform with thredUP’s Resale-As-A-Service (RaaSⓇ), which facilitates modern resale for a number of the world’s leading brands and retailers. thredUP has processed over 125 million unique secondhand items from 35,000 brands across 100 categories. By extending the life cycle of clothing, thredUP is changing the way consumers shop and ushering in a more sustainable future for the fashion industry.

CKM is at the forefront of building products that inform strategic decision-making and drive operational improvement for customers. We’re seeking Senior Data Scientists/Data Science Managers who will help us lead the way in solving critical business problems and derive valuable insights for our customers. The candidate should also possess a desire to foster strong relationships with our customers and be driven to help our customers achieving their goals. At times the candidate may be asked to research and develop new product capabilities at other times the candidate may be asked to help lead the delivery of our solutions to our customers. They are quick to adapt to new technology, and passionate about data-driven business problem solving for business operations. They also thrive in cross-functional teams and can clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical individuals.

The Data Team at Zoom brings data closer to the decision. We know that to deliver customer happiness we need to build best in class products. We support this by empowering Product with behavioral insights to help them build better products. This role will be part of the Product Intelligence team and will be working closely with the Zoom Phone product team. Zoom Phone is a feature-rich cloud phone system with inbound/outbound calling through the public switched telephone network (PSTN) with local PSTN service available in 45+ countries and expanded coverage available through a bring-your-own carrier offering. This role will work closely with Product, Engineering and the Data Engineering team to help ensure the success of the product. The ideal candidate will have experience partnering with Product to define success metrics and define data requirements to ensure we are set up for success when the product or feature launches. The individual will play a key role in providing insights around product usage beyond just the “What?” but to answer the “Why?” behind user behavior. Our team values diversity, collaboration, creativity and most importantly - having fun! Come join us!

Job Title: Data Scientist- TikTok Ads, Brand Innovation
Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View (CA), Seattle, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

We're the TikTok Monetization Products data science team, who enables and champions data driven decision making. Our Vision is to become the world class data science team, where data is used rigorously to drive all decision making. Our Mission is to drive monetization and sustainable revenue growth for TikTok through data science.

The Brand Innovation team focuses on branding advertising, Spark Ads and innovative ad formats. We provide branding solutions including common brand ad products (e.g., Reach & Frequency, Brand Auction) and brand ad products that are unique to TikTok (e.g., Hashtag Challenge, Branded Mission). Spark Ads is a native ad format that enables advertisers to leverage organic TikTok posts and their features to advertise for both brand campaigns and direct response campaigns. As a data scientist on the Brand Innovation team, we partner with product managers, engineers and other cross-functional teams in the product journey, providing data insights that support and lead the product incubation and continued growth.

Responsibilities
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Make your career a force for good!
We are seeking a Principal Data Scientist to work virtually from a home-office with occasional in-person meetings as necessary. Preference for candidate to be in the Mid-Atlantic states (NC, SC, VA) &/or work east coast hours.
Position Summary:
The Enterprise Data and Analytics (EDA) group supports ETL and data warehousing activities for almost every line of business at the American Red Cross. In the EDA Data Science group we use this data to create modern, impact-focused data science products. As a Principal, Data Scientist in the EDA Data Sciences group, you’ll be responsible for acquiring, manipulating, and presenting data within a highly complex data environment. You’ll provide business value through data mining, machine learning, advanced algorithms, statistical modeling, building data pipelines and data science workflows, and frequent collaboration with business stakeholders. You’ll apply specialized technical expertise to execute projects of high complexity, scope, size and/or risk that support business needs across the enterprise. The successful candidate will have a strong background in both research methodology and data engineering. This position serves as a lead on projects, assists in identifying new business needs, and provides training and guidance to other staff.

Supporting the Disney Advertising Sales organization within our Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) segment, the Audience Modeling and Data Science team are subject matter experts in each of the following areas:
Creating and optimizing audience classification models that enable us to predict and target strategic audience attributes, including brand affinity, purchase behavior, and psychographics
Integrating a broad suite of complex datasets, from digital event logs to sporting event metadata, into carefully curated and reusable data models
Publishing audience attributes across an array of ad-serving endpoints
Working cross-functionally to ensure our data product is aligned with the goals of each strategic sales vertical and the business as a whole

We’re looking for an intellectually curious, business-savvy, analytical powerhouse to join The Walt Disney Company’s DMED segment as a data scientist on the ad sales team. In this role, you will be responsible for driving improvements across DMED’s portfolio of offerings by using data. Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, you will develop, drive, and oversee new strategies to ensure the growth of the business and the overall bottom line.






B.A. or B.S. (MS, MBA, or PhD a plus) in a quantitative field (Math/Statistics, CS, Engineering, Business, Economics, experimental science, or similar)

About Us
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role
The Central Science team focuses on understanding the long-term and causal impact of actions taken by viewers, creators and Twitch. We discover insights and build prediction and causal inference tools to make these knowledge more accessible for teams across Twitch. We support a diverse set of customers including executive leaders, product managers and data staff. We are an interdisciplinary team with experts in data science, statistics, and economics.

Company Description

Experian is the world’s leading global information services company. During life’s big moments – from buying a home or a car, to sending a child to college, to growing a business by connecting with new customers – we empower consumers and our clients to manage their data with confidence. We help individuals to take financial control and access financial services, businesses to make smarter decisions and thrive, lenders to lend more responsibly, and organizations to prevent identity fraud and crime.
As the world’s leading repository of consumer credit data, Experian is transforming data into solutions that facilitate transactions, ensure financial safety and improve the financial lives of millions of consumers around the world. We have been named by Forbes magazine as one of the “World’s Most Innovative Companies" and ranked on Fortune’s Best Companies to work for.

Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn't just the Best Place to Play — it's also the Best Place to Work. Today, we're recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, PlayStation™Now, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

Overview

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Responsibilities

Process massive amounts of structured and unstructured data.

Build advanced supervised and unsupervised machine learning models for batch and real-time applications.

Research new machine learning solutions to complex business problems.

Develop and deploy models in production using Python.

Run A/B test experiments and analyze results.

Communicate findings to non-technical audience.

Stay current with new tools and techniques in the literature.

Qualifications

Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field (PhD preferred)

Excellent communication skills.

Strong background in machine learning and statistics.

Solid foundation in data structures and algorithms.

Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (including Numpy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn).

Ability to write complex SQL queries.

Experience training deep neural networks.

Experience with natural language processing.

4 or more years of industry experience building ML and statistical models.

Job Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning, Creator Analytics
Job Description:
About Us
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.
About the Role:
Data scientists play a central role in Twitch's data-driven decision-making process. As a data scientist at Twitch, you will shape the way product performance is measured, identify questions that guide our business and product strategy, apply machine learning methods to uncover new insights, and scale our analytic methods and tools to support our growing business.

Overview

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Responsibilities

Process massive amounts of structured and unstructured data.

Build advanced supervised and unsupervised machine learning models for batch and real-time applications.

Research new machine learning solutions to complex business problems.

Develop and deploy models in production using Python.

Run A/B test experiments and analyze results.

Communicate findings to non-technical audience.

Stay current with new tools and techniques in the literature.

Qualifications

Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field (PhD preferred)

Excellent communication skills.

Strong background in machine learning and statistics.

Solid foundation in data structures and algorithms.

Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (including Numpy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn).

Ability to write complex SQL queries.

Experience training deep neural networks.

Experience with natural language processing.

4 or more years of industry experience building ML and statistical models.

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

About NetApp

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Overview

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Responsibilities

Process massive amounts of structured and unstructured data.

Build advanced supervised and unsupervised machine learning models for batch and real-time applications.

Research new machine learning solutions to complex business problems.

Develop and deploy models in production using Python.

Run A/B test experiments and analyze results.

Communicate findings to non-technical audience.

Stay current with new tools and techniques in the literature.

Qualifications

Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field (PhD preferred)

Excellent communication skills.

Strong background in machine learning and statistics.

Solid foundation in data structures and algorithms.

Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (including Numpy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn).

Ability to write complex SQL queries.

Experience training deep neural networks.

Experience with natural language processing.

4 or more years of industry experience building ML and statistical models.

Job summary
Amazon's Quantitative Business Intelligence Tools (QuBIT) team is looking for motivated individuals with strong analytical and science skills to evolve one of the most complex supply-chain systems in the world.

Amazon’s supply-chain comprises thousands of fixed infrastructure nodes with millions of possible connections between them. Billions of packages flow through this network on a yearly basis, making the impact of optimal improvements truly innovative. This job offers is a terrific opportunity to analyze Amazon data and understand, model, optimize, and reshape one of the world's most supply-chains.

Your main focus will be on developing predictive models for critical planning entities; analyzing large amount of data to identify and evaluate opportunities to improve customer experience, network speed, cost and efficiency; and presenting the results to non-technical audience with the aid of visualization tools. You will leverage optimization approaches to evaluate trade-offs between potentially competing business objectives and improve decision-making. You will identify effective metrics to quantify the improvements resulting from the application of your developed tools.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate deep understanding of statistical and machine learning concepts, technical skills for leveraging analytical tools to solve large scale problems, aptitude to remain abreast with data science related technologies and excitement to take iterative approaches to tackle long-term challenges. The successful candidate will have good communication skills and ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience; will collaborate effectively with fellow scientists, data/software engineers, and product/program managers; and will deliver business value in a close partnership with many stakeholders from operations, finance and software-engineering.

Key job responsibilities
In this role, you'll be expected to work on well defined business problems related to Amazon Fulfillment Center Operations (labor planning, capacity planning, etc) and use the appropriate data science techniques to design and implement a workable solution for them. You'll also work alongside the product/program managers to define the success criteria for the solution and set up the appropriate tracking/reporting mechanisms.

About the team
The science team within QuBIT comprises 6 data scientists coming from a diverse background! Our mission is to continuously evolve our operations by developing robust and well-researched science solutions. Outside of constantly adding business value through those solutions, our team keeps abreast of evolving science field by learning new concepts and algorithms dedicatedly every week, and we share the knowledge across team members through monthly learning sessions!

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Overview

Viva Insights aims to create cultures where people and business thrive by reimagining how people and organizations should work together. We are here to help employees feel better and be better at work. Learn more about Viva Insights: Improve Employee Wellbeing | Microsoft Viva Insights
Viva Insights Behavioral Science, Data Science and Product Analytics is a team of data scientists and behavioral scientists that work together to leverage advanced analytics, ML/AI techniques, and behavioral research to find new ways to measure human behavior, drive specific, measurable, and impactful improvements to the Viva Insights product, and conduct research to discover new interventions to help our customers thrive at work. The person in this role will work with our product team and the broader Microsoft research community to bring validated findings from internal research and research from the field into our product strategy. He or she will also work with our product teams to inject data science expertise into the features and design of the products.

Your Job
As a Senior Data Scientist embedded in the International Team team, you will be tasked with building machine learning solutions to help improve the efficiency of software delivery at Indeed. You will work on interesting and important challenges that range from designing algorithms for quicker regression testing to building tools that can automate root cause analysis. Through your work, Indeed software developers will be able to quickly get their solutions into production, find and fix bugs, and improve the quality of their code.

The International Team works to make all of Indeed’s products effective at getting people hired, in every market and language. This involves translating the needs of specific markets into configuration patterns that let us scale those variations worldwide. We consider both sides of the experience, meaning that we internationalize employer-facing products (such as posting jobs and managing candidates) and jobseeker-facing products (such as mobile job search, updating profiles, and messaging-app based experiences). Most importantly, the team is expected to deliver results, and be able to demonstrate the impact our changes have on our business.

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Communicate findings to non-technical audience.

Stay current with new tools and techniques in the literature.

Solid foundation in data structures and algorithms.

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job summary
Amazon's Quantitative Business Intelligence Tools (QuBIT) team is looking for motivated individuals with strong analytical and science skills to evolve one of the most complex supply-chain systems in the world.

Amazon’s supply-chain comprises thousands of fixed infrastructure nodes with millions of possible connections between them. Billions of packages flow through this network on a yearly basis, making the impact of optimal improvements truly innovative. This job offers is a terrific opportunity to analyze Amazon data and understand, model, optimize, and reshape one of the world's most supply-chains.

Your main focus will be on developing predictive models for critical planning entities; analyzing large amount of data to identify and evaluate opportunities to improve customer experience, network speed, cost and efficiency; and presenting the results to non-technical audience with the aid of visualization tools. You will leverage optimization approaches to evaluate trade-offs between potentially competing business objectives and improve decision-making. You will identify effective metrics to quantify the improvements resulting from the application of your developed tools.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate deep understanding of statistical and machine learning concepts, technical skills for leveraging analytical tools to solve large scale problems, aptitude to remain abreast with data science related technologies and excitement to take iterative approaches to tackle long-term challenges. The successful candidate will have good communication skills and ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience; will collaborate effectively with fellow scientists, data/software engineers, and product/program managers; and will deliver business value in a close partnership with many stakeholders from operations, finance and software-engineering.

Key job responsibilities
In this role, you'll be expected to work on well defined business problems related to Amazon Fulfillment Center Operations (labor planning, capacity planning, etc) and use the appropriate data science techniques to design and implement a workable solution for them. You'll also work alongside the product/program managers to define the success criteria for the solution and set up the appropriate tracking/reporting mechanisms.

About the team
The science team within QuBIT comprises 6 data scientists coming from a diverse background! Our mission is to continuously evolve our operations by developing robust and well-researched science solutions. Outside of constantly adding business value through those solutions, our team keeps abreast of evolving science field by learning new concepts and algorithms dedicatedly every week, and we share the knowledge across team members through monthly learning sessions!

The base pay range for this position in Colorado is $ 119,300 - $160,000 a year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon’s internal or external careers site.

About NetApp

We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Preferred Skills:
Applicant Privacy Notice:

About NetApp

We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Facts


Manager with direct reports

The Opportunity
This role will leverage your technical skills and business acumen as you deliver insights that inform Teladoc’s most important business decisions. You will collaborate closely with partners and leaders to support strategic cross-functional initiatives that help us keep costs in check, maximize revenue and impact a greater number of people living with chronic and behavioral conditions.
This role offers a chance to have a meaningful impact on our business outcomes. Come help us break new ground, while measurably improving lives and saving millions in healthcare costs.
Responsibilities
Support detailed analyses, modeling, and experimentation for mission-critical functions within the marketing teams driving member enrollment and utilization.

M.S. or equivalent in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering, Computer Science, or related analytical disciplines.
Deep understanding of regression modeling, forecasting techniques, time series analysis, machine-learning concepts such as supervised/unsupervised learning, in-depth knowledge of tree-based ensemble models, etc.
Excellent in using statistical, visualization, and machine-learning tools and commercial packages
Proficiency in using SQL as applied to big data: extraction, processing, filtering, and presenting large data quantities (100K to Millions of rows) via AWS technologies and data pipelines
Excellent one or more scripting languages (e.g., Python, R, Java, C++, etc.)
Ability to communicate technical concepts and solutions at a level appropriate for technical and non-technical audiences.
Job summary
Amazon's Quantitative Business Intelligence Tools (QuBIT) team is looking for motivated individuals with strong analytical and science skills to evolve one of the most complex supply-chain systems in the world.

Amazon’s supply-chain comprises thousands of fixed infrastructure nodes with millions of possible connections between them. Billions of packages flow through this network on a yearly basis, making the impact of optimal improvements truly innovative. This job offers is a terrific opportunity to analyze Amazon data and understand, model, optimize, and reshape one of the world's most supply-chains.

Your main focus will be on developing predictive models for critical planning entities; analyzing large amount of data to identify and evaluate opportunities to improve customer experience, network speed, cost and efficiency; and presenting the results to non-technical audience with the aid of visualization tools. You will leverage optimization approaches to evaluate trade-offs between potentially competing business objectives and improve decision-making. You will identify effective metrics to quantify the improvements resulting from the application of your developed tools.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate deep understanding of statistical and machine learning concepts, technical skills for leveraging analytical tools to solve large scale problems, aptitude to remain abreast with data science related technologies and excitement to take iterative approaches to tackle long-term challenges. The successful candidate will have good communication skills and ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience; will collaborate effectively with fellow scientists, data/software engineers, and product/program managers; and will deliver business value in a close partnership with many stakeholders from operations, finance and software-engineering.

Key job responsibilities
In this role, you'll be expected to work on well defined business problems related to Amazon Fulfillment Center Operations (labor planning, capacity planning, etc) and use the appropriate data science techniques to design and implement a workable solution for them. You'll also work alongside the product/program managers to define the success criteria for the solution and set up the appropriate tracking/reporting mechanisms.

About the team
The science team within QuBIT comprises 6 data scientists coming from a diverse background! Our mission is to continuously evolve our operations by developing robust and well-researched science solutions. Outside of constantly adding business value through those solutions, our team keeps abreast of evolving science field by learning new concepts and algorithms dedicatedly every week, and we share the knowledge across team members through monthly learning sessions!

A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job summary
Amazon's Quantitative Business Intelligence Tools (QuBIT) team is looking for motivated individuals with strong analytical and science skills to evolve one of the most complex supply-chain systems in the world.

Amazon’s supply-chain comprises thousands of fixed infrastructure nodes with millions of possible connections between them. Billions of packages flow through this network on a yearly basis, making the impact of optimal improvements truly innovative. This job offers is a terrific opportunity to analyze Amazon data and understand, model, optimize, and reshape one of the world's most supply-chains.

Your main focus will be on developing predictive models for critical planning entities; analyzing large amount of data to identify and evaluate opportunities to improve customer experience, network speed, cost and efficiency; and presenting the results to non-technical audience with the aid of visualization tools. You will leverage optimization approaches to evaluate trade-offs between potentially competing business objectives and improve decision-making. You will identify effective metrics to quantify the improvements resulting from the application of your developed tools.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate deep understanding of statistical and machine learning concepts, technical skills for leveraging analytical tools to solve large scale problems, aptitude to remain abreast with data science related technologies and excitement to take iterative approaches to tackle long-term challenges. The successful candidate will have good communication skills and ability to speak at a level appropriate for the audience; will collaborate effectively with fellow scientists, data/software engineers, and product/program managers; and will deliver business value in a close partnership with many stakeholders from operations, finance and software-engineering.

Key job responsibilities
In this role, you'll be expected to work on well defined business problems related to Amazon Fulfillment Center Operations (labor planning, capacity planning, etc) and use the appropriate data science techniques to design and implement a workable solution for them. You'll also work alongside the product/program managers to define the success criteria for the solution and set up the appropriate tracking/reporting mechanisms.

About the team
The science team within QuBIT comprises 6 data scientists coming from a diverse background! Our mission is to continuously evolve our operations by developing robust and well-researched science solutions. Outside of constantly adding business value through those solutions, our team keeps abreast of evolving science field by learning new concepts and algorithms dedicatedly every week, and we share the knowledge across team members through monthly learning sessions!

The base pay range for this position in Colorado is $ 119,300 - $160,000 a year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon’s internal or external careers site.

Job Title: Principal Data Scientist, SNKRS (Open to remote work, except the following locations: SD, VT, and WV)
Job Description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for an experienced, hands-on Principal Data Scientist who is excited to cultivate and serve a dedicated sneakerhead community. You love cutting edge machine learning, and bringing it to production to serve users. You will drive ambitious roadmaps, lead and mentor data scientists, and partner with a diverse set of partners.

About NetApp

We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. About NetApp

We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

The Product Science and Analytics team is looking for a Junior Data Scientist. In this role, you will need to gain an understanding of our platform, including the predictive, simulation, and optimization models that power it – as well as how those models impact our underlying business. You will be expected to monitor and maintain existing prediction, optimization, and simulation engines. You will also implement custom queries against our data warehouse, run statistical data analyses, and other types of analyses related to platform performance. You will work closely with a dedicated science and software engineering team, as well as key operational teams, to validate and ensure platform KPI performance!


Work with data scientists, data engineers, and software engineers to deliver analysis aimed at underlying business objectives
Execute data driven methodologies to improve product performance and capability
Monitor and maintain platform health, as determined by Vantage business leadership
Ensure technical approaches taken by the Science and Analysis team are appropriate for their objective and underlying data structure
Brainstorm new functionality and features for future platform improvements
Work with semi-technical and non-technical business units in delivering actionable insights from large data sets


Passion for problem-solving and the ability to find answers to difficult questions – the sort of answers that others might struggle to find
Acute attention to detail, strong critical thinking skills, and excellent time management skills
Experience working with production data science systems
Proficiency with extracting insights from large data sets and communicating the results to non-technical staff
Highly proficient in Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables) and PowerPoint
Comfortable programming in Python and SQL
Basic grasp of relational database structures and data management
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure (Amazon Web Services) or Unix/Linux based systems.
Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM field with 2+ years professional experience in data analytics, media tech or ad tech -OR- Master’s/Ph.D. in a STEM field.


Experience in media at an agency, network, or ad-tech firm with a fundamental understanding of digital, addressable, programmatic and/or television advertising
Experience working in a team environment
Strong written and oral communication skills, including experience building and leading presentations
A committed, entrepreneurial approach to building businesses within a fast-paced environment focused on changing the way partners perceive our brand and our product
