Data & Analysis – Data Scientist
We are the connected marketing agency, a full-service agency with modern creative & media, data, and technology services all under one roof.
The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.
Digitas’ Data Science practice sits within our DNA (Data & Analysis) capability, and develops industry-leading analytical solutions for clients across industries, channels and business functions. We apply a bespoke and cutting-edge arsenal of statistical, analytical and computing techniques to complex data problems at scale, with an emphasis on game-changing—and measureable—business impact. We work in close collaboration with colleagues across all agency disciplines to develop truly innovative, highly effective, data-powered solutions for our clients.
To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Data Scientist – an intellectually curious and creative problem solver who is willing to tackle the familiar and unfamiliar of all things data, including methods, technologies and applications. Sound like you? Read on.


Our Data Scientists deliver analytic solutions across a wide variety of client applications. We build inferential and predictive models, including machine learning algorithms and AI; we process, integrate and manipulate big data with distributed systems and customer data pipelines; we synthesize results and translate findings into compelling stories that resonate with clients.
As a Data Scientist , you’ll address complex marketing and business challenges—from cross-channel media and customer experience optimization to segmentation, targeting and business strategy—by accessing, integrating, manipulating, mining and modeling a wide array of data sources.

Overview

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

Job Title: Data Scientist- TikTok Ads, Brand Innovation
Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View (CA), Seattle, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

We're the TikTok Monetization Products data science team, who enables and champions data driven decision making. Our Vision is to become the world class data science team, where data is used rigorously to drive all decision making. Our Mission is to drive monetization and sustainable revenue growth for TikTok through data science.

The Brand Innovation team focuses on branding advertising, Spark Ads and innovative ad formats. We provide branding solutions including common brand ad products (e.g., Reach & Frequency, Brand Auction) and brand ad products that are unique to TikTok (e.g., Hashtag Challenge, Branded Mission). Spark Ads is a native ad format that enables advertisers to leverage organic TikTok posts and their features to advertise for both brand campaigns and direct response campaigns. As a data scientist on the Brand Innovation team, we partner with product managers, engineers and other cross-functional teams in the product journey, providing data insights that support and lead the product incubation and continued growth.

Responsibilities
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. Paramount delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, the company provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions.
Advertising on all formats is being reinvented through new business models and the combination of big data, predictive analytics, optimization and other modern data science and analysis techniques. Paramount's Advanced Advertising Group is at the forefront of this reinvention of advertising and is currently looking for key new individuals to join our team!

The Product Science and Analytics team is looking for a Junior Data Scientist. In this role, you will need to gain an understanding of our platform, including the predictive, simulation, and optimization models that power it – as well as how those models impact our underlying business. You will be expected to monitor and maintain existing prediction, optimization, and simulation engines. You will also implement custom queries against our data warehouse, run statistical data analyses, and other types of analyses related to platform performance. You will work closely with a dedicated science and software engineering team, as well as key operational teams, to validate and ensure platform KPI performance!


Work with data scientists, data engineers, and software engineers to deliver analysis aimed at underlying business objectives
Execute data driven methodologies to improve product performance and capability
Monitor and maintain platform health, as determined by Vantage business leadership
Ensure technical approaches taken by the Science and Analysis team are appropriate for their objective and underlying data structure
Brainstorm new functionality and features for future platform improvements
Work with semi-technical and non-technical business units in delivering actionable insights from large data sets


Passion for problem-solving and the ability to find answers to difficult questions – the sort of answers that others might struggle to find
Acute attention to detail, strong critical thinking skills, and excellent time management skills
Experience working with production data science systems
Proficiency with extracting insights from large data sets and communicating the results to non-technical staff
Highly proficient in Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables) and PowerPoint
Comfortable programming in Python and SQL
Basic grasp of relational database structures and data management
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure (Amazon Web Services) or Unix/Linux based systems.
Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM field with 2+ years professional experience in data analytics, media tech or ad tech -OR- Master’s/Ph.D. in a STEM field.


Experience in media at an agency, network, or ad-tech firm with a fundamental understanding of digital, addressable, programmatic and/or television advertising
Experience working in a team environment
Strong written and oral communication skills, including experience building and leading presentations
A committed, entrepreneurial approach to building businesses within a fast-paced environment focused on changing the way partners perceive our brand and our product

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Responsibilities

Process massive amounts of structured and unstructured data.

Build advanced supervised and unsupervised machine learning models for batch and real-time applications.

Research new machine learning solutions to complex business problems.

Develop and deploy models in production using Python.

Run A/B test experiments and analyze results.

Communicate findings to non-technical audience.

Stay current with new tools and techniques in the literature.

Qualifications

Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field (PhD preferred)

Excellent communication skills.

Strong background in machine learning and statistics.

Solid foundation in data structures and algorithms.

Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (including Numpy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn).

Ability to write complex SQL queries.

Experience training deep neural networks.

Experience with natural language processing.

4 or more years of industry experience building ML and statistical models.

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

We're the TikTok Monetization Products data science team, who enables and champions data driven decision making. The successful candidate will gain an understanding of the data science techniques to power TikTok monetization and drive meaningful improvements in ads targeting and ranking models.

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

About NetApp

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Responsibilities

Process massive amounts of structured and unstructured data.

Build advanced supervised and unsupervised machine learning models for batch and real-time applications.

Research new machine learning solutions to complex business problems.

Develop and deploy models in production using Python.

Run A/B test experiments and analyze results.

Communicate findings to non-technical audience.

Stay current with new tools and techniques in the literature.

Qualifications

Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field (PhD preferred)

Excellent communication skills.

Strong background in machine learning and statistics.

Solid foundation in data structures and algorithms.

Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (including Numpy, Pandas, and Scikit-learn).

Ability to write complex SQL queries.

Experience training deep neural networks.

Experience with natural language processing.

4 or more years of industry experience building ML and statistical models.

Job Summary

NetApp is transforming Operations Planning with AI/ML based forecasting capabilities and processes. As a Data Scientist focused on Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP), you will play a critical role in designing and implementing forecast algorithms, planning processes and tools. You will analyze big data, provide analytics and insights, build models and algorithms to improve demand predictability and accuracy. Your data driven insight will inform decision making and help the organization become more agile, scalable, and efficient. You will work closely with other data scientists and the planning team drive process/system improvements.

To be successful in this role, you must be a motivated self-starter with a passion for solving business problems using data and analytics, a team player who can collaborate cross functionally, a strong communicator with leadership. The ideal candidate is an analytical expert with a practical understanding of supply chain operations.


Analyze large data from various source to create forecast models for Sales & Operations Plan
Identify critical data and data patterns to improve demand predictability and accuracy
Run models and what-if scenarios (product transitions, demand generation, supply constrained plan, etc.) to evaluate planning assumptions and quantify impact
Develop data visualization and dashboards
Track S&OP KPI and conduct ad-hoc analysis to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities
Plan/coordinate product transitions with cross-functional team to ensure supply continuity, enable revenue and proactively mitigate excess & obsolete inventory
Determine appropriate buffer for demand volatility
Provide data driven insights that help in operational decision-making processes such as strategic spend, cost reduction and supply chain strategy
Facilitate and lead S&OP Plan review with various functions
Lead root cause identification and continuous improvement efforts in the S&OP planning process
Assist in supply and demand optimization by providing demand outlook and risk assessment
Lead efforts to enhance forecasting tools/systems; project manage as appropriate
Job Requirements
8+ years of overall work experience with 5+ years in an analytical role; experience in building forecasting models
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Demonstrated proficiency in data analytics. Understanding of how data is constructed within the systems and ability to source information for analysis
Experience in building data models using statistical forecast and AI/ML techniques
Working knowledge of SQL, R or Python
Experience with data visualization/BI SW (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of the new product development, new product life cycle and product phase out processes
Ability to manage ambiguity and address unstructured or less defined problems
Problem solver and change agent who can identify problems in advance and propose solutions
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization. Comfortable making executive presentations
Ability to build rapport with all key stakeholders
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities through understanding impact on business results
Experience with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle) a plus
Knowledge & experience in Planning and Supply Chain Operations, highly desired
Education

Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain Operations. Master’s degree a plus

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View (CA), Seattle, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

We're the TikTok Monetization Products data science team, who enables and champions data driven decision making. Our Vision is to become the world class data science team, where data is used rigorously to drive all decision making. Our Mission is to drive monetization and sustainable revenue growth for TikTok through data science.

Ads Targeting, Auction and Delivery are the key parts of TikTok online advertising platform - an automatic system that optimizes which ads to display to users and determines how much advertisers should pay for them. The successful candidate will gain an understanding of the data science techniques to power TikTok monetization and drive meaningful improvements in ads targeting and ranking models.

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. Paramount delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. Advertising on all formats is being reinvented through new business models and the combination of big data, predictive analytics, optimization and other modern data science and analysis techniques. Paramount's Advanced Advertising Group is at the forefront of this reinvention of advertising and is currently looking for key new individuals to join our team!

The Product Science and Analytics team is looking for a Junior Data Scientist. You will be expected to monitor and maintain existing prediction, optimization, and simulation engines. Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

We are currently seeking a Senior Data Scientist for a full time, permanent position (remote).
The Data Science team builds machine learning models that recommend best-match candidates for jobs. The team’s mission is to build the world’s best AI matchmaker that can connect all jobs with the right jobseekers.
Responsibilities
Build highly scalable and performant recommendation systems and technologies that can identify best matches between millions of jobs and millions of job seekers in real-time
Experiment with POC ML model improvements, scale them to production, and run iterative AB experiments to improve our matching technology

At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for an experienced, hands-on Principal Data Scientist who is excited to cultivate and serve a dedicated sneakerhead community. You love cutting edge machine learning, and bringing it to production to serve users. You will drive ambitious roadmaps, lead and mentor data scientists, and partner with a diverse set of partners.

Paramount Global (NASDAQ: PARA, PARAA) is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic studios, networks and streaming services, Paramount's portfolio of consumer brands includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. Paramount delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, the company provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions.
Advertising on all formats is being reinvented through new business models and the combination of big data, predictive analytics, optimization and other modern data science and analysis techniques. Paramount's Advanced Advertising Group is at the forefront of this reinvention of advertising and is currently looking for key new individuals to join our team!

The Product Science and Analytics team is looking for a Junior Data Scientist. In this role, you will need to gain an understanding of our platform, including the predictive, simulation, and optimization models that power it – as well as how those models impact our underlying business. You will be expected to monitor and maintain existing prediction, optimization, and simulation engines. You will also implement custom queries against our data warehouse, run statistical data analyses, and other types of analyses related to platform performance. You will work closely with a dedicated science and software engineering team, as well as key operational teams, to validate and ensure platform KPI performance!

Overview

Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.

Process massive amounts of structured and unstructured data.

Communicate findings to non-technical audience.

Stay current with new tools and techniques in the literature.

Overview
Interested in creating balance between productivity and wellbeing in the workplace? Come join us! Viva Insights aims to create cultures where people and business thrive by reimagining how people and organizations should work together. We are here to help employees feel better and be better at work. Learn more about Viva Insights: Improve Employee Wellbeing | Microsoft Viva Insights
Viva Insights Behavioral Science, Data Science and Product Analytics is a team of data scientists and behavioral scientists that work together to leverage advanced analytics, ML/AI techniques, and behavioral research to find new ways to measure human behavior, drive specific, measurable, and impactful improvements to the Viva Insights product, and conduct research to discover new interventions to help our customers thrive at work. In an environment of high opportunity and impact, we are looking for a strong and experienced Data Scientist to help conduct and apply research within the Viva Insights portfolio of products. This person will create models and help design and research interventions that are intended to support our customers’ goals. The person in this role will work with our product team and the broader Microsoft research community to bring validated findings from internal research and research from the field into our product strategy. He or she will also work with our product teams to inject data science expertise into the features and design of the products.

When you join Verizon
Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.
What you’ll be doing...
This role is part of our Network Enablement team within Verizon's Artificial Intelligence and Data (AI&D) center of excellence and is responsible for program and project coordination and support across multiple groups within Global Network and Technology (GN&T). We are tasked with bringing innovative AI/ML solutions to the business units that allow them to enable efficiencies.
The Artificial Intelligence and Data (AI&D) organization focuses on delivering the power of data and AI to drive our marketplace leadership through innovative solutions that create value for our customers, shareholders, V Teamers, and society; responsibly.
You'll use your analytics expertise to enhance our customer experience by ensuring best-in-class network quality, increasing efficiency, and predicting and preventing network issues. You'll partner with the business to understand problems and develop actionable insights and solutions to solve them. Most projects start with descriptive analytics to rapidly answer and visualize the who, what, when, where, why, and how types of questions. You’ll then move into deeper statistical analysis and visualization. Our work is less about research and development, and more about solving actual business problems with data science methodologies. All of our work is worked cross-functionally, hand in hand with the business partners, domain experts, partner teams, and each piece is well documented along the way. Regular reviews of use cases occur with leadership, which requires using data to tell the story of importance, priority, value, and benefit.

Rec Room is the best place to build and play games together. Chat, hang out, explore MILLIONS of rooms, or build something new to share with us all! As a Senior Product Data Scientist at Rec Room, you will be responsible for a large strategic area and will use data to be an advocate for our players. Your insights into what users are doing on the platform will inform broader team strategy and impact their short and long-term roadmap. You'll be equal parts leader, investigator, and storyteller, shaping experiences towards delighting players and building a sustainable business.
As we scale, Product Data Scientists will embed within individual teams, and as the Senior Product Data Scientist, you would be expected to drive product thinking at the broader team level and guide other data scientists as needed. You might be helping the econ team think through how to scale the buyer and builder ecosystem, or helping the growth team think through how to give users more reason to return to the app. You might also help the User Generated Content team think through how to enable creators to build the best products, or the social team how to make a player's experience more meaningful. The questions and potential for impact are huge.

Why work at WebXT
Inside Microsoft's Web Experiences Team

Overview:

Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and we believe that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. The Core Search and AI team is the leading applied machine learning team at Microsoft responsible for delivering the highest-quality experience to over 500M+ monthly active users around the world in Microsoft’s search engine, Bing. Beyond Bing other search engines such as Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, and new startups like Neeva depend on us as well.

We have seen little innovation in search in the last decade and we are looking for people who want to build the next generation of search using advanced AI technologies such as deep learning. Our work spans a very large scope of scenarios including delivering high quality search results from a massive document corpus, extractive and abstractive summarization to generate document snippets, personalization, machine reading comprehension, and document recommendations.

Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.
Micron’s Smart Manufacturing and Artificial Intelligence Innovation team is growing and searching for exceptional and innovative data scientists. In this position, you will be enabling advanced AI algorithms, working on multidisciplinary projects in end-to-end teams from different geographic locations to develop, prototype, and deploy artificial intelligence and machine learning solutions into business, engineering, and manufacturing processes globally across Micron. You will have the opportunity to identify and enable state-of-art algorithms and solutions to challenging problems, constantly learn new technologies and creatively apply/deliver solutions to global operations to enable Micron to continue to lead in this competitive landscape.

Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

We are currently seeking a Senior Data Scientist for a full time, permanent position (remote).
The Data Science team builds machine learning models that recommend best-match candidates for jobs. The team’s mission is to build the world’s best AI matchmaker that can connect all jobs with the right jobseekers.
Responsibilities
Build highly scalable and performant recommendation systems and technologies that can identify best matches between millions of jobs and millions of job seekers in real-time
Experiment with POC ML model improvements, scale them to production, and run iterative AB experiments to improve our matching technology

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View (CA), Seattle, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

We're the TikTok Monetization Products data science team, who enables and champions data driven decision making. Our Vision is to become the world class data science team, where data is used rigorously to drive all decision making. Our Mission is to drive monetization and sustainable revenue growth for TikTok through data science.

The Brand Innovation team focuses on branding advertising, Spark Ads and innovative ad formats. We provide branding solutions including common brand ad products (e.g., Reach & Frequency, Brand Auction) and brand ad products that are unique to TikTok (e.g., Hashtag Challenge, Branded Mission). Spark Ads is a native ad format that enables advertisers to leverage organic TikTok posts and their features to advertise for both brand campaigns and direct response campaigns. As a data scientist on the Brand Innovation team, we partner with product managers, engineers and other cross-functional teams in the product journey, providing data insights that support and lead the product incubation and continued growth.

The Climate Corporation's mission is to help the world's farmers sustainably increase their productivity with digital tools. The Climate Corporation leads the industry in connected acres, and the rapidly growing volume of on-farm data, in combination with other large data resources, are opening new opportunities to deploy advanced computational and machine learning methods to help farmers increase their productivity and improve the sustainability of their practices.

In order to take advantage of increasing amounts of agricultural and genetic data, the Climate Corporation is seeking an experienced, self-motivated and hands-on Data Scientist to join the Modeling Team. You will focus on supporting and developing new data science methodology to understand key drivers of crop performance for various cropping systems.

Overview:
Global video game publisher/developer headquartered in Rockville MD, seeks a Data Scientist- Psychology to join the Enterprise Business Intelligence team. This position works within the Enterprise BI Team and is responsible for conducting research using game, customer, and business data.

The incumbent will have at least 2 years of relevant experience partnering with both technical and business teams to facilitate research. The Data Scientist-Psychology will work within a multidisciplinary Data Science team to help answer questions about how customers interact with our products and provide research on those interactions.

Help the studio better understand its data and provide recommendations to help optimize design, shape business strategy, and make predictions to improve the customer experience

Microsoft's mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and we believe that artificial intelligence will play a critical role in accomplishing that mission. We have seen little innovation in search in the last decade and we are looking for people who want to build the next generation of search using advanced AI technologies such as deep learning. Your insights into what users are doing on the platform will inform broader team strategy and impact their short and long-term roadmap. You'll be equal parts leader, investigator, and storyteller, shaping experiences towards delighting players and building a sustainable business.
As we scale, Product Data Scientists will embed within individual teams, and as the Senior Product Data Scientist, you would be expected to drive product thinking at the broader team level and guide other data scientists as needed. You might be helping the econ team think through how to scale the buyer and builder ecosystem, or helping the growth team think through how to give users more reason to return to the app. You might also help the User Generated Content team think through how to enable creators to build the best products, or the social team how to make a player's experience more meaningful. You are energized by developing and evaluating long-term strategic options and business objectives in a large and dynamic renewable natural resource-based organization. Job Title: North America Applied Field Data Scientist
Job Description:
About Syngenta
Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
About Us
The North America Applied Field Data Scientist (NA-AFD) is responsible for the review and optimization of trialing and operational resources improving delivery of commercial launches in the NA Seeds Development organization reporting through the Applied Genetics Organization. The NA-AFD will support market segment teams of corn, soybean, hybrid wheat organizations by conducting reviews and power analysis of current trialing footprints across crops and market segments, review and challenge phenotypic data collection protocols and proof of concepts (POCs) to improve the heritability of key traits collected by trialing and nursery teams to drive downstream predictions, and assist in development, validating and scale-up of image-based phenotypic solutions. The NA-AFD collaborates with other Applied Genetics Scientist, Discovery Breeding, Data Analytics Scientists, and Operational Research Teams to implement new data analytics, trialing designs and phenotyping techniques to continue to drive speed and quality of commercial launches.

We are currently seeking a Senior Data Scientist for a full time, permanent position (remote).
The Data Science team builds machine learning models that recommend best-match candidates for jobs. The team’s mission is to build the world’s best AI matchmaker that can connect all jobs with the right jobseekers.
Responsibilities
Build highly scalable and performant recommendation systems and technologies that can identify best matches between millions of jobs and millions of job seekers in real-time
Experiment with POC ML model improvements, scale them to production, and run iterative AB experiments to improve our matching technology
